95f167d3-9384-4847-b2a0-d87818bf6b24.description: The earner of this badge understands the fundamentals of computer problem solving and programming – techniques, concepts, and vocabulary (CIS-116). The earner can apply the fundamentals of algorithms and object-oriented software development (CIS-216). This earner can work with data structures and software modeling (CIS-256). The earner of this badge achieved a 90%, or higher, final average in each of the three courses.
95f167d3-9384-4847-b2a0-d87818bf6b24.name: Computer Science - Excellence

ab78beb6-4a19-4f81-96ea-72da4dc73bd3.description: Earners of the Level I accounting badge will understand debits and credits and the tasks needed to get started in a career in accounting. 7ab1cf38-dbef-4929-a8dc-00736a479239.description: This micro-credential sequence is structured to prepare students for a concentration in early childhood. A micro-credential badge from FMCC provides a foundation for students who would like to pursue careers in related fields and gain greater knowledge on the significant importance of early childhood. The first eight years of life is the period where major brain development occurs. Course content will help students to gain an understanding of this critical phase of life.
7ab1cf38-dbef-4929-a8dc-00736a479239.name: Early Childhood Education - Excellence

issuer.summary: issued by Fulton Montgomery Community College

18d23f5e-d790-4312-8561-e3c2912aed38.description: The earner will articulate the fundamentals of the Human Services field. The earner will perform appropriate engagement strategies and utilize attending behaviors which underlie the Human Services field. The earner will evaluate the influence of one's personal values and ethics in order that professional values and ethics guide practice. The earner will design and implement a service learning project within the Human Services field.
18d23f5e-d790-4312-8561-e3c2912aed38.name: Human Services Learner

issuer.summary: issued by Fulton Montgomery Community College

20178128-7ca5-4514-aed3-ce5d91b24a73.description: This Micro-Credential is designed to educate HVAC technicians on various methods and refrigeration products, providing a safe and eco-friendly outcome with each service. The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) requires all HVAC technicians that work with refrigerants to be certified.
20178128-7ca5-4514-aed3-ce5d91b24a73.name: HVAC Refrigerant Techniques

issuer.summary: issued by Fulton Montgomery Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Type I - Limits HVAC technicians to working on appliances which contain no more than five pounds of refrigerant.
Type II - Permits HVAC technicians to perform work on high pressure appliances.
TYPE III - Limits HVAC technicians to working on low-pressure appliances.
New York EPA Section 608 Proctored Exam - Each section of this test includes 100 questions for complete certification.

41645cc0-b39e-43e3-816e-ea15784c630d.description: Earners of this badge will understand the evolving legal and regulatory framework of the emerging cultivation industry in NYS while learning about the growing. In addition, they will learn a variety of hydroponics growing methods and growth requirements of a variety of plant species. Students will develop an understanding of the inter relationships between and among plant and animal species is complemented by topics from comparative anatomy and physiology.
41645cc0-b39e-43e3-816e-ea15784c630d.name: Introduction to Cannabis Cultivation Policy and Procedures - Excellence

issuer.summary: issued by Fulton Montgomery Community College

14ee422c-4399-4680-bdde-25dd8317f5a8.description: Earners of the level II Advanced accounting and finance badge demonstrates a working knowledge of bookkeeping and accounting that empowers them to succeed in careers including accounts receivable, accounts payable, bookkeeping, payroll and the management of the accounting function for an accounting practice or entrepreneurial business.

4ce44205-99e9-461d-ac4a-25a88378cf8d.description: Earners of this badge will possess the skills needed to pursue careers as coders in a variety of healthcare settings. Earners will understand medical terms, reimbursements and how to file a claim, documentation of medical conditions and procedures using current coding language along with basic human anatomy and physiology including anatomical terminology. This badge will prepare the student to take the Coding Certification Exam. Earners must pass classes with an A- or better.
4ce44205-99e9-461d-ac4a-25a88378cf8d.name: Medical Coding V2 - Excellence

issuer.summary: issued by Fulton Montgomery Community College

92bde834-b71a-469d-b8ab-900168653f18.description: Earners of this badge will have the skills to provide clerical support to a medical practice. Earners will be proficient in keyboarding skill, understand how to create business documents, understand medical terms, able to properly answer incoming calls, greet patients, check patients in/out, file medical paperwork and be the point person for any administrative needs. Earners must pass the following classes with an A- or better.
92bde834-b71a-469d-b8ab-900168653f18.name: Medical Office Representative V2 - Excellence

issuer.summary: issued by Fulton Montgomery Community College

813e8dce-1d46-480c-be62-e09c97bf07d6.description: This badge addresses the increasing expectations of diverse workplaces and functioning in a multicultural society. It is a foundation for individuals who would like to pursue careers in Sociology, Diversity and Inclusion, or Multicultural Affairs. Badge earners have explored how race, social class, gender, religion, and sexual orientation influence social justice and learn evidence-based approaches to mitigate structural violence and create just and equitable environments.
813e8dce-1d46-480c-be62-e09c97bf07d6.name: Multiculturalism and Diversity - Excellence

issuer.summary: issued by Fulton Montgomery Community College

badge_template_activities.title: HIS 189 – African American History(3 credits) or HIS 110 – History of Russia (3 credits), SOC 200 – Diversity in America ( 3 credits), SOC 285 – Gender in Society (3 credits)•  A  Credential of Excellence is rewarded upon completion of each course in the defined sequence with a minimum grade of “A-” in each required course.

f99791a3-d531-4655-b906-cd46ec98fa9c.description: The earner of this badge has demonstrated competency in the core concepts of financial literacy, consistent with the goal of personal wealth management for individuals. The earner understands long term investment objectives, including liquidity, solvency, and wealth creation, and the trade off between risk and reward. The earner is able to establish budgets, manage credit card and long term debt and create a diversified portfolio of securities consistent with stated investment objectives.
f99791a3-d531-4655-b906-cd46ec98fa9c.name: Personal Wealth Management - EXCELLENCE

issuer.summary: issued by Fulton Montgomery Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the following courses with grades consistent with the EXCELLENCE CREDENTIAL STANDARDS of FMCC: BUS 162 - Personal Finance, BUS 262 - Investments, ECO 282 - Macroeconomics.

c33d5ba5-765d-4575-8220-7f37b4705313.description: Earners of this badge will understand the importance of proper written and oral communication in the workplace and how to use these skills when applying for a job, seeking a promotion, or enhancing their skillset. Using these written and communication skills, the student will communicate ideas, persuade, track, present, calculate, organize, and share information in a clear, concise, and effective method. Earners must pass classes with an A- or better.
